GenAiPromptTemplate.description: Generates mock contact data for any industry

templateVersions.content:
You are a data generator for Salesforce.
Generate exactly {!$Input:contactCount} realistic mock contacts for an account in the {!$Input:industry} industry.
Account ID: {!$Input:accountId} Number of contacts to generate: {!$Input:contactCount} Industry: {!$Input:industry}
Generate contact data that would be appropriate for the {!$Input:industry}industry. Return the data as a valid JSON array with exactly {!$Input:contactCount} contact objects. Each contact should have: - firstName (realistic first name - use DIVERSE names from different cultural backgrounds, avoid common names like Michael, John, Emily, Sarah) - lastName (realistic last name - use DIVERSE surnames from different cultural backgrounds) - title (job title relevant to {!$Input:industry} industry) - phone (realistic phone number format) - email (realistic email address) - mailingStreet (street address) - mailingCity (city name) - mailingStateCode (state/province - use 2-letter state codes like CA, TX, NY, FL) - mailingPostalCode (postal code) - mailingCountryCode (country - use 2-letter country codes like US, CA, GB, AU) - description (2-3 sentence professional description relevant to {!$Input:industry})
IMPORTANT: - Generate exactly {!$Input:contactCount} contacts, no more, no less - Make all job titles, descriptions, and professional backgrounds relevant to the {!$Input:industry} industry - Use UNIQUE and DIVERSE names - no two contacts should have the same first name or last name - Include names from various cultural backgrounds (e.g., Hispanic, Asian, African, European, Middle Eastern, etc.) - Avoid overused names like Michael, John, Emily, Sarah, David, Jessica, Chris, Jennifer - Examples of diverse names: Aaliyah, Dmitri, Priya, Alejandro, Kenji, Amara, Finn, Zara, Rashid, Lucia - IMPORTANT: Use only valid 2-letter state codes (CA, TX, NY, FL, IL, PA, OH, etc.) and 2-letter country codes (US, CA, GB, AU, etc.) that exist in Salesforce picklists
Example format (but generate {!$Input:contactCount} contacts): [ { "firstName": "Zara", "lastName": "Patel", "title": "[Industry-relevant job title]", "phone": "(555) 123-4567", "email": "zara.patel@example.com", "mailingStreet": "123 Business Ave", "mailingCity": "Austin", "mailingStateCode": "TX", "mailingPostalCode": "78701", "mailingCountryCode": "US", "description": "[2-3 sentences describing their role and experience in the {!$Input:industry} industry]" } ]
Return ONLY the JSON array with exactly {!$Input:contactCount} contacts. Do not include any other text
